summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing scheduling and the outcome of an oral argument in a FOIA case related to Jeffrey Epstein. The argument was before Judge Engelmayer, who expressed skepticism about the breadth of the government's withholdings under FOIA Exemption 7(A) and will order in camera review. The court also directed communication with Audrey (likely a supervisor) about reconsidering the FOIA response in light of the new administration.

persons.name: Audrey
persons.context: Mentioned as someone to be consulted about joining a call and to whom the court directed a communication regarding reconsideration of the FOIA response in light of the new administration.

persons.name: Judge Engelmayer
persons.context: Presided over the oral argument in the Epstein FOIA case, expressed skepticism about the breadth of the government's withholdings, and will order in camera review and specific marking of documents.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the main email summarizing the oral argument before Judge Engelmayer, coordinating follow-up calls, and handling the FOIA litigation.

connections.description: The AUSA is directed by the court to communicate with Audrey about the case and to have her evaluate the FOIA response.
The AUSA appeared before Judge Engelmayer in oral argument regarding the Epstein FOIA case and is receiving directives from the court.

events.title: Oral Argument in Epstein FOIA Case
events.description: A roughly two-hour oral argument was held before Judge Engelmayer regarding FOIA requests related to Jeffrey Epstein. The court was skeptical of the government's broad use of Exemption 7(A) to withhold documents.

events.title: Expected Court Order for In Camera Review
events.description: Judge Engelmayer is expected to issue an order directing the government to produce withheld documents for in camera review and to specifically mark materials withheld in connection with the Tartaglione case.

keyFacts: Judge Engelmayer is highly skeptical of the government's broad use of FOIA Exemption 7(A) to withhold documents related to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating potential overreach.
The court will order in camera review of the withheld documents and require specific marking of materials related to the Tartaglione case versus the broader 'Noel' case.
The court directed the AUSA to have Audrey (a supervisor) reconsider the FOIA response, specifically noting the recent change in administration might be relevant.
The court inquired about how much of the withheld material had been produced to defendants in the 'Noel' case under Rule 16, suggesting scrutiny of consistency in disclosure.
